subject: Languages
title: The Anglo-Saxon Arrival
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Anglo-Saxon Arrival.

hook.text: When Romans left Britain in 410 AD, three Germanic tribes sailed in and rewrote the island's future.

buildup.text: The Angles, Saxons, and Jutes brought dialects from what is now Germany and Denmark.

twist.text: The word 'English' comes from 'Angles' â€” one tribe named an entire language.

climax.text: By 700 AD, Old English had its own poetry, legal codes, and a growing literature.

punchline.text: English began as an immigrant language on someone else's island.

quiz.question: Where does the word 'English' come from?
